title: [QUESTION] Code does not adhere to editorconfig
body:
When making PRs, I noticed that some of the code gets formatted according to the `.editorconfig`  rules, but the original file wasn't. This can cause a lot of merge conflicts.

For example, it seems the following two formatting options in the `.editorconfig` are not followed in the source code:

```cs
		public SKPaint ()
			: this (SkiaApi.sk_compatpaint_new (), true)
		{
			if (Handle == IntPtr.Zero) {
				throw new InvalidOperationException ("Unable to create a new SKPaint instance.");
			}
		}
```

Notice the space after the `SKPaint` method declaration and the `sk_paint_new` method call.

The rules in the `.editorconfig` file however are

```
csharp_space_between_method_call_name_and_opening_parenthesis = false
csharp_space_between_method_declaration_name_and_open_parenthesis = false
```

Also the `csharp_new_line_before_open_brace = all` is not followed in the above code.

Unfortunately, not all files are wrong, some indeed follow the rules...

Reformatting the code using Resharper changes a lot of files.

Not sure what the best approach would be? Should a PR reformat the whole file, applying the editorconfig rules?
